channel.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Model Renderer for Unity 4.x Pro
channel.description:
Hey there guys!
This is something small I created for testing the runescape classic models inside of unity. My thought was to port my current C# client to use Unity as base. I have not continued with this yet as I'm working on a completely different project at the moment.
But for those who wants to try this out, are free to do so!
GIT: https://github.com/zerratar/UnityRSCLib
https://www.dropbox.com/s/jef30jxq5i02doy/Unity%20RSC%20Model%20Renderer.zip
inside this .zip file there is two main scripts that you can use.
1. RSCModelHandler.cs 2. RSCModelRenderer.cs
To use these, first create a new GameObject (Empty) and AddComponent -> RSCModelHandler, the RSCModelHandler will basically just read from the config.jag and models.jag (Resources/config.bytes .../models.bytes)
and push all the models in a static array.
Now, to render a RSC Model.
Add a new empty GameObject, this one you can place where you want the RSC Model to be seen in the scene. Add Component -> RSCModelRenderer.cs, under the settings for the script you can prompt which model to render "Model Name"
you can set it to something like "tree" just for testing it out. the model name is not case sensetive, nor do you have to enter the whole modelname as it will take the string and find the first model with the name that contains the text you entered.
arrr.. So entering "tree" will just pick "tree1" or what not.
A mesh collider will automatically be created for the models you render. Also; if you want to add more rsc models to the scene, just add another empty gameobject with the same script as component.
PS. Make sure you're using the VertexColorShader.shader thats included in the zip file, otherwise you'll have a bad time.
Any questions? Just ask.

item.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Model Renderer for Unity 4.x Pro

I’m happy you guys like it. Anyone tried it out yet?

item.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Model Renderer for Unity 4.x Pro
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

As soon as I get time for it I will add the support for textured models, landscape loading, etc. The code is already done, I just need to modify it to work with unity.

RSCTextureHandler, RSCLandscapeHandler, RSCSpriteHandler

Read full topic

item.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Model Renderer for Unity 4.x Pro
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

Hey there guys!

This is something small I created for testing the runescape classic models inside of unity. My thought was to port my current C# client to use Unity as base. I have not continued with this yet as I’m working on a completely different project at the moment.

But for those who wants to try this out, are free to do so!

GIT:

GitHub

zerratar/UnityRSCLib

UnityRSCLib - An open source RuneScape Classic library for Unity 4.x

Dropbox

Dropbox - Error

Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!

inside this .zip file there is two main scripts that you can use.

  1. RSCModelHandler.cs
  2. RSCModelRenderer.cs

To use these, first create a new GameObject (Empty) and AddComponent -> RSCModelHandler,
the RSCModelHandler will basically just read from the config.jag and models.jag (Resources/config.bytes …/models.bytes)

and push all the models in a static array.

Now, to render a RSC Model.

Add a new empty GameObject, this one you can place where you want the RSC Model to be seen in the scene.
Add Component -> RSCModelRenderer.cs, under the settings for the script you can prompt which model to render “Model Name”

you can set it to something like “tree” just for testing it out. the model name is not case sensetive, nor do you have to enter the whole modelname as it will take the string and find the first model with the name that contains the text you entered.

arrr… So entering “tree” will just pick “tree1” or what not.

A mesh collider will automatically be created for the models you render.
Also; if you want to add more rsc models to the scene, just add another empty gameobject with the same script as component.

PS. Make sure you’re using the VertexColorShader.shader thats included in the zip file, otherwise you’ll have a bad time.

Any questions? Just ask.
